content.question: The polar function is a portion of a loop with a horizontal orientation. Moving from the center to the outside of the grid: The function curves from 0 upward and to the right. The function passes radii of 2 and 4 and then reaches a maximum distance from the polar axis. The function then curves downward and to the right until it reaches the radius of 6. The polar function is a portion of a loop with a horizontal orientation. Moving from the center to the outside of the polar grid: The function curves from 0 downward and to the right. The function passes radii of 2 and 4 and then reaches a maximum distance from the polar axis. The function then curves upward and to the right until it reaches the radius of 6. The polar function is a portion of a loop with a horizontal orientation. Moving from the center to the outside of the polar grid: The function curves from 0 upward and to the left. The function passes radii of 2 and 4 and then reaches a maximum distance from the polar axis. The function then curves downward and to the left until it reaches the radius of 6. The polar function is a portion of a loop with a horizontal orientation. Moving from the center to the outside of the polar grid: The function curves from 0 downward and to the left. The function passes radii of 2 and 4 and then reaches a maximum distance from the polar axis. The function then curves upward and to the left until it reaches the radius of 6. Consider the graph of the polar function <math alttext="r equals f open parentheses theta close parentheses"><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>θ</mi></mfenced></math>, where <math alttext="f open parentheses theta close parentheses equals negative 6 cos theta"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>θ</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>cos</mi><mpadded lspace="+2px"><mi>θ</mi></mpadded></math>, in the polar coordinate system. Which of the following is the graph of <math alttext="r equals f open parentheses theta close parentheses"><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>θ</mi></mfenced></math> for <math alttext="0 less or equal than theta less or equal than pi over 2"><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo>≤</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math> ?

choices.label: Graph of a portion of a polar function on a polar grid. The positive horizontal axis is labeled Polar axis. The polar grid radii range from 0 to 6 in increments of two thirds. The grid angles are in increments of pi over 12. Refer to long description.
